business.headline: Sensex closes 247 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Eternal up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 247.01 points to close at 82,253.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 67.55 points to end at 25,082.30.

Trap, click, renew: How OTT apps make it hard to cancel subscriptionsAccording to data collected by community platform LocalCircles, 50% of respondents said they have frequently had difficulty cancelling subscriptions to digital services.

Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta on why your portfolio should be yours, not someone else'sBuilding your investment portfolio should match your own risk comfort, timeframe and goals. What works for your friend may not work for you, says MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, Radhika Gupta.

Why your tax refund may be delayed this yearOne big reason for the delay is that the tax filing season began late this year. Normally, people can file their returns from April onwards. But this time, the Income Tax Department released the ITR utilities quite late.
Sensex down 400 points: Why is stock market falling todayAs of 11:50 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down by 388.85 points to 82,111.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 110.85 points to 25,039.00.

Only 6.7% filed ITRs: CoinSwitch co-founder on why Indians delay tax filingIndia has made big progress in digital tax filing over the years. There are new portals, better forms and more ways to pay taxes online. Yet, millions still wait till the last few days to get their documents in order.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares gained 5% todayOla Electric share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 43.60 before trading 5.45% higher at Rs 41.99 around 11:11 am, shortly after the electric two-wheeler maker announced its financial results for the first quarter of FY26.

Bitcoin zooms past $120,000 to reach all-time high. Here's whyThe world's largest cryptocurrency was last seen trading at $120,700.54, up 1.32%, as investor confidence remained strong ahead of important regulatory discussions in the United States.
Sensex, Nifty start week in red as IT stocks drag markets lower againThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 266.34 points to 82,234.13, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 67.95 points to 25,081.90 as of 9:22 am.

Travel Food Services to make market debut today; here's the latest GMPTravel Food Services listing: The grey market premium (GMP), which had dropped sharply in the past week, has seen a slight rise ahead of the listing.

Jane Street deposits Rs 4,843.5 crore, set to return to Dalal Street: ReportIn its interim order, Sebi had accused Jane Street of using manipulative strategies in Indian stock markets. The regulator directed the firm to deposit alleged unlawful gains in an escrow account with a scheduled commercial bank in India.

Why claiming your PF money seems so difficultIt all starts with tiny mistakes. A spelling error in your name, a mismatch in your date of birth, or an old bank account number can be enough to freeze your claim.

entertainment.headline: Pakistani drama group stages Ramayana in KarachiA Karachi-based drama group stages 'Ramayana,' using AI enhancements. The production has been well-received by the audience.

Justin Bieber's holiday pics with Hailey Bieber spark cultural appropriation debateSinger Justin Bieber's recent pictures with Hailey Bieber recently sparked debate on social media. A section of users linked one of the photos, which appears to be in a dark background, to Justin's past remarks on racism and people of colour.

Reformed review: Elsa Guedj's French drama starts strong but falters in executionReformed web series review: The JioHotstar series 'Reformed' follows the journey of a young woman named Lea, in her early 20s, who has just become a rabbi. The show starts off with charm, heart, and a fresh voice, but it loses its way halfway through. What could have been a standout series becomes just another show.

Diljit greets media with folded hands in 1st public appearance amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowDiljit Dosanjh was clicked by the media as he exited the airport on July 14, acknowledged his fans and smiled for the paps. The 41-year-old recently wrapped 'Border 2', and this was his first public outing amid the 'Sardaar Ji 3' row.
BTS' V shares new profile picture, fans wonder who's kissing himBTS member V has once again made fans go into a frenzy with his updated profile picture. Take a look at the picture and see why.

Pakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali's last voice note to friend emerges onlinePakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali was found dead in her Karachi apartment, with reports revealing she died around nine months ago. A voice note she sent to a friend before her death has now surfaced online.

Kota Srinivasa Rao: From bank desk to big screen, a career spanning 750 filmsKota Srinivasa Rao was more than just a character actor. From a bank job to over 750 films and a brief political stint, his journey was one of dedication, honesty, and depth.

Kangana Ranaut says MPs are disrespected, work with less budget than MLAsKangana Ranaut highlighted the lack of respect and budget constraints faced by MPs. She described them as being 'nowhere' and welcomed the DISHA initiative as a step forward.

Preity Zinta, Neena and Masaba Gupta attend Wimbledon Final in London. See picsActor Preity Zinta and her husband Gene Goodenough attended the Wimbledon final in London. Neena Gupta and her daughter Masaba were also seen at the event. They shared photos from the thrilling tennis event on Instagram.

The Revolutionaries first look: Nikkhil Advani recreates Indian freedom struggleThe first look of Prime Video's 'The Revolutionaries' was recently unveiled. The Nikkhil Advani directorial is based on the Indian freedom struggle against British rule.

Ram Gopal Varma says media exaggerated Deepika Padukone vs Sandeep Vanga issueRam Gopal Varma says fixed working hours is a conversation that has to happen between a director and an actor, and the media exaggerated the entire Deepika Padukone-Sandeep Reddy Vanga issue.

Karan Johar's daughter Roohi joins labubu trend: It's not a trend, it's my friendKaran Johar shared a cute video of his daughter Roohi confidently calling her Labubu doll a 'friend', not just a trend, winning hearts online. The video went viral, with fans and celebrities showering love on Roohi's adorable response.

Emotional Jr NTR meets Kota Srinivasa Rao's family, asks them to not chant Jai NTRJr NTR visited Kota Srinivasa Rao's family to offer condolences and called his death an 'irreplaceable loss' to Telugu cinema. He urged fans to celebrate the legendary actor's legacy through his performances, saying, "There is only one like him."

Rajinikanth mourns Saroja Devi's death: The great actress who won million heartsRenowned South Indian actor B Saroja Devi has died at 87 due to age-related ailments. Superstar Rajinikanth paid his last respects to the actor on X.

Lollapalooza Berlin: J-hope owns the stage and delivers as BTS was watchingBTS member J-Hope rocked the stage in Berlin at the Lollapalooza festival. Meanwhile, his fellow band members tuned in live on Weverse to show their support. Find out which members joined the online concert.

Rajeev Khandelwal recalls quitting Kahiin Toh Hoga, choosing quality over moneyActor Rajeev Khandelwal recently opened up on the perception around him after he quit Ektaa Kapoor's 'Kahiin To Hoga' (2003-2005). He mentioned the negative articles written about him at that time.

Legendary South actor B Saroja Devi dies at 87B Saroja Devi, one of South Indian cinema's most iconic and beloved female actors, died at 87. Known for her memorable roles across Tamil, Telugu, and Kannada films, she was a towering figure in Indian cinema for over six decades.

Superman box office day 3: James Gunn's film flies high, crushes 1st weekend numbers'Superman' rocked a fabulous first weekend at the Indian box office. The James Gunn-directorial has impressed the Indian audience, and is looking at recording a good first week.

Urvashi Rautela carries labubus to Wimbledon, internet can't stop laughingUrvashi Rautela's photos from Wimbledon 2025 went viral after she carried four Labubu dolls to the match while wearing a white gown. Fans on social media shared funny comments and memes about her unique look.

general news.headline: Isn't it jarring? Supreme Court asks states, Centre to regulate hate speechThe Supreme Court bench observed that people should be made aware of the value of freedom of speech as no one wants the state to step in to regulate it.

Video: Omar Abdullah scales wall to reach Martyrs' Graveyard day after 'house arrest'Chief Minister Omar Abdullah climbed a railing along with his cabinet ministers to visit the Martyrs' Graveyard in Nowhatta and pay floral tributes. On Sunday, several leaders from the ruling National Conference were put under house arrest in a bid to stop them from marking Martyrs' Day today.

LIVE: Shubhanshu Shukla to undock from Space Station shortlyAxiom 4 Mission Return Live Updates: Commander Peggy Whitson from the USA, Sawosz Uznaski-Winiewski from Poland, Tibor Kapu from Hungary, India's Shubhanshu Shukla will undock from the Space Station to begin their return journey to Earth. They will take 21 hours to re-enter Earth's atmosphere and splashdown on Tuesday.

Only a few miles separate Lord's and Wimbledon. On Sunday they were eons apartOn Sunday, Lord's and Wimbledon, mere miles apart in London, revealed a vast divide. Cricket's gentlemanly grace has faded to gladiatorial fire, while tennis holds fast to elegance, reflecting humanity's eternal dance between battle and beauty.

Supreme Court scraps 1,158 Punjab professor, librarian jobs over faulty processThe top court set aside a September 2024 ruling by a division bench of the Punjab and Haryana High Court, which had previously upheld the appointments.

Sneha Debnath dropped signs of emotional turmoil, hinted suicide, say loved onesThe 19-year-old Delhi University student from Tripura also left a handwritten note behind, revealing her intent to jump from the Delhi Signature Bridge.

Nothing much government can do: Centre on Nimisha Priya's execution in YemenThe government told the Supreme Court that it has exhausted all diplomatic options to secure the release or prevent the execution of Kerala nurse Nimisha Priya in Yemen.

How Titaura, Nepal's tangy treat, found a home in one of India's best barsTitaura is a beloved Nepalese snack made primarily from a fruit, lapsi, and that ingredient is slowly giving way to creativity in cocktail bars in India.

No mechanical faults found in crashed plane: Air India CEO on probe reportAir India CEO Campbell Wilson also pointed out that both pilots had cleared mandatory pre-flight breath analyser tests, and that the AAIB report made no observations related to their medical status.

Samosa and jalebi to carry cigarette-like warnings; campaign kicks off in NagpurIn a first-of-its-kind move, the Health Ministry is rolling out visual health warnings for high-fat and high-sugar foods like samosas and jalebis, starting with AIIMS Nagpur.

Tesla set to debut in India tomorrow, likely to launch the Model YTesla is set to enter the Indian market on July 15 with the likely launch of the Model Y SUV, marking a significant milestone in the country's rapidly growing electric vehicle landscape.

How Brad Pitt's Tangaliya shirt in 'F1' movie spotlights a 700-year-old Indian craftPitt's onscreen character has put Tangaliya's handwoven artistry on the global stage, but can the attention help revive a fading tradition?

Yesterday's coffee is today's coffee: What it takes to survive at Space StationGrabbing the morning-coffee mug is muscle memory on Earth. But at the International Space Station (ISS), even that's a feat of science and improvisation. With Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla set to return from the ISS after 18 days, here's a peek into the strange, disciplined, and ingenious life 400 km above Earth.

Former Miss Puducherry who spoke against colourism dies by suicideModel and pageant winner San Rechal Gandhi, who challenged colourism and advocated for women's safety, passed away in Puducherry after a reported overdose of sleeping pills. She had represented India in several international modelling events.

Sena MP questions Air India crash report's hushed release, leaks to global pressPriyanka Chaturvedi has questioned how Air India flight 171's crash report was leaked abroad before India's official disclosure, calling the late-night release opaque and demanding a formal probe.

Saina Nehwal announces separation from Parupalli Kashyap after 7 years of marriageBadminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have decided to separate after nearly 7 years of marriage. Saina announced her decision in an Instagram post on Sunday, July 13.

Is China's rare-earth weaponisation giving India a rare chance?China, the biggest holder of rare earths, is weaponising them by restricting the supply. Though it has hit the EV industry in India, will the country, which possesses the third-biggest reserve of rare earths, be able to use this as a rare opportunity?

Case against YouTuber for AI video on Karnataka temple town mass burial caseKarnataka Police have booked a YouTuber for allegedly circulating an AI-generated video with false content linked to a complaint involving forced corpse disposal in the temple town of Dharmasthala.

Flee Mamdani's tyranny: Vivek Ramaswamy supporters begin billboard battle in NYA Times Square billboard, funded by a pro-Vivek Ramaswamy group, urges New Yorkers to "flee" Zohran Mamdani's "socialist tyranny" and move to Ohio. Ramaswamy, a Republican leader, is promoting Ohio as a "freer, more prosperous alternative" to New York.

Club World Cup may be more important than Champions League in future: MarescaChelsea head coach Enzo Maresca made headlines after his team's 3-0 win over Paris Saint-Germain in the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup final, calling the title a global triumph and claiming the competition now rivals - or even surpasses - the Champions League in prestige.

With six wickets in hand, India need 135 more runs to take a 2-1 lead in the five-match Test series at Lord's.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
